name: accordina (harmonica/accordion hybrid)
description: Harmonica/Accordion hybrid where the bellows for the accordion bit with buttons/keys receive air though the user blowing into the instrument like an harmonica

name: accordion
description: The accordion is a rectangular free-reed bellows-driven instrument with a keyboard & buttons.

name: algozey
description: The algozey is a wooden, beaked double-flute traditionally played by goat herders in the Punjab region of India and Pakistan.

name: alphorn
description: The alphorn, or alpine horn, is a conical wood horn used for communication in mountains.

name: alto clarinet
description: The alto clarinet is a clarinet in E♭ or sometimes F, normally with a curved neck.

name: alto flute
description: The alto flute is a concert flute in G, lower in tone than the flûte d'amour.

name: alto saxophone
description: The alto saxophone is a woodwind invented by Adolphe Sax which is between the tenor and soprano in size.

name: Anglo concertina (historical hybrid between English and German style concertinas)
description: bisonoric and button layout like the german and reeds and hexagonal ends like the english, this concertina was created to rival the popular german variant imported into england.

name: arghul
description: The arghul is a traditional Egyptian double-pipe, single-reed woodwind instrument.

name: bagpipe
description: The bagpipe is an instrument consisting of a series of enclosed reeds fed by a bag of air.

name: bandoneón
description: The bandoneón is a type of bisonoric concertina popular in parts of South America and in Lithuania.

name: bansuri
description: The bansuri is a transverse alto flute, which is the North Indian counterpart to the venu.

name: baritone horn
description: The baritone horn is a piston valve brass instrument with a wide-rimmed cup mouthpiece which is pitched in B♭, one octave below the B♭ trumpet.

name: baritone saxophone
description: The baritone saxophone is the largest and lowest-pitch saxophone in wide use.

name: baroque rackett (Conical bored compact double reed)
description: Improved by Johann Christoph Denner sometime around 1730, its "coiled snake" bore now is conical, in addition it is played through a removable metal curled mouth piece.

name: baroque trumpet (20th century reinvented natural trumpet)
description: Based on the natural trumpet used in the 1500s to 1700s, this mid 20th century reinvention lacks valves but may have vents.

name: barrel organ
description: A barrel organ is a mechanical musical instrument typically operated by a person turning a crank which turns a barrel which has music encoded onto it.

name: bass clarinet
description: The bass clarinet is a clarinet, typically pitched an octave below the soprano B♭ clarinet.

name: bass flute
description: The bass flute is a flute, pitched one octave below the C concert flute, with a tube about 1.5 meters long.

name: bass harmonica
description: The bass harmonica is a type of octave harmonica where the lowest note (E) is the same as that on a bass guitar.

name: bass oboe
description: The bass oboe is a double reed woodwind instrument which is about twice the size of a regular oboe.

name: bass saxophone
description: The bass saxophone is the second largest existing member of the saxophone family (not counting the subcontrabass tubax). It is similar in design to a baritone saxophone, but it is larger, with a longer loop near the mouthpiece.

name: bass trumpet
description: The bass trumpet is a type of low trumpet similar to the valve trombone.

name: bawu
description: The bawu is a Chinese wind instrument. Although shaped like a flute, it is actually a free reed instrument, with a single metal reed. It is played in a transverse (horizontal) manner.

name: bazooka
description: The bazooka is a brass musical instrument several feet in length which incorporates telescopic tubing.

name: bellow-blown bagpipes
description: Bagpipes played by pumping air into a bellow and then from the bellow into the chanter(s).

name: birch lur (Wooden natural brass)
description: Known from the Viking age, this natural brass trumpet/horn was made of wood or birch bark

name: bombarde
description: conical bore double-reed musical instrument from Brittany

name: bronze lur (Bronze age natural brass)
description: Chiefly Scandinavian, these bronze age natural brass horns were ritualistically buried in pairs.

name: buisine
description: The buisine was a type of straight medieval trumpet usually made of metal.

name: Cembalet (an electric piano with reeds)
description: an electromechanical piano with stainless steel reeds and amplified pick-up

name: chalumeau
description: The chalumeau is a single-reed woodwind instrument of the late baroque and early classical era.

name: chamber organ
description: A chamber organ is a small pipe organ.

name: chirimía (oboe-like double-reed from South-America)
description: a relative of the shawm, it was introduced to central and south-america by the spanish in the sixteenth and seventeenth century.

name: cimbasso (19th century bass trombone)
description: Its name variously used to describe the serpentone, the ophicleide and the bombardon, the modern cimbasso was developed by instrument making firm Pelitti under instruction guidance by Verdi; it had a forward facing bell and 3 to 6 valves. The modern instrument has a characteristic bend.

name: claviola (free reed aerophone with pitching pipes.)
description: free reed melodica like instrument that is worn like an accordion, with differenting length pipes which control the pitch

name: concert flute
description: The concert flute is the most common variant of the flute and is commonly referred to as just "flute".

name: conch
description: conch shell

name: cornamuse
description: The cornamuse is a double reed instrument from the Renaissance, similar to the crumhorn but with a closed bell.

name: cornet (19th century brass trumpet-like)
description: Early 19th century brass instrument with a conical bore, it is more compact and mellower than the trumpet which it resembles.

name: cornett (Wooden medieval wind instrument)
description: Cornett, cornetto or zink (not to be confused with the cornet) was a medieval wind instrument popular from 1500 to 1650.

name: crumhorn
description: Crumhorn used in the 14th to 17th centuries in Europe

name: daegeum
description: The daegeum is a large transverse flute from Korea which is made of bamboo.

name: danso (Korean educational end-blown bamboo flute)
description: Used in folk music and educationally in Korean schools, it is a notched, vertically end-blown bamboo flute which, like its bigger cousin the Tungso, was derived from the Chinese xiao in the 19th century.

name: descant recorder / soprano recorder
description: A descant or soprano recorder is the most common size of recorder and is often learnt by children.

name: đing buốt
description: edo village traditional flute, four finger holes, blowing reed

name: đing năm
description: The đing năm is a gourd mouth organ used by minority ethnic groups in the central highlands of Vietnam.

name: ding tac ta
description: The ding tac ta is a free reed wind instrument played by the Ê Đê minority in Vietnam. It is made of a bamboo tube with three holes and a gourd wind chamber.

name: dizi
description: The dizi is a Chinese transverse flute typically made of bamboo. In Chinese, it is sometimes just called 笛 (di), but in Japanese 笛 (fue) is a more generic word referring to a whole class of flutes rather than this specific instrument.

name: duck call
description: Short wooden flute used to imitate the sound of ducks

name: duduk
description: The duduk is a traditional Armenian double reed woodwind instrument.

name: dulcian
description: The dulcian is a double reed bass woodwind instrument which is a 16th century ancestor of the bassoon.

name: E-flat clarinet
description: The E♭ clarinet is a member of the clarinet family.

name: English concertina (unisonoric concertina)
description: unisonoric concertina with hexagonal sides and concertina reeds.

name: English flageolet (English "improved" flageolet)
description: working to improve on its design, the English flageolet had 6 finger holes in front and one thumb hole in the back.

name: English horn (Transposing oboe)
description: While also known as Cor anglais, it is neither a horn nor English, but a transposing member of the oboe family, pitched at F

name: fife
description: Small, high-pitched, transverse flute, similar to the piccolo, but with a narrower bore.

name: flabiol (Small Catalan fipple flute)
description: Small Catalan flageolet used in the cobla ensemble, unlike other tabor-pipes it is also played with both hands.

name: flageolet (french 16th century fipple flute)
description: while today it is obscure, it was developed and improved for 400 years, the French flageolet has 4 holes in front and two thumb holes in the back

name: flumpet (Hybrid between trumpet and flugelhorn)
description: As long as a trumpet, it shares the piston valve design of both instruments with a mellow sound between the two.

name: flute
description: A flute is an aerophone or reedless wind instrument that produces its sound from the flow of air across an opening.

name: flûte d'amour
description: The flûte d'amour is the mezzo-soprano instrument of the flute family.

name: fourth flute
description: The fourth flute is a recorder with a lowest note of B♭, a fourth above the treble/alto recorder.

name: fujara
description: The fujara is a large folk shepherd's fipple flute originated from central Slovakia.

name: gemshorn (Medieval chamois or goat horn)
description: Medieval or possibly older, it was historically made of goat-horns or, less commonly, clay. With only a few holes and a single octave range it was used pastorally. Modern revival variants are more complicated and are usually made of cattle-horn.

name: German concertina (bisonoric concertina)
description: more usually square than hexagonal, with long plate reeds

name: gralla
description: The gralla is a traditional Catalan double reed instrument in the oboe family.

name: guan
description: The guan is a Chinese double reed wind instrument made from hardwood or bamboo.

name: härjedalspipa (fipple flute from Härjedalen, sweden)
description: six holed fipple flute used traditionally in pastoral settings like its cousin the spilåpipa.

name: harmonica (mouth organ)
description: Used especially in blues, American folk and country, it consists of a rectangle shape with soundholes along the wide side, where air is blown and drawn across free reeds which are mounted on a plate inside.

name: hichiriki
description: The hichiriki is a double reed Japanese flute used as one of two main melodic instruments in Japanese gagaku music.

name: hmông flute
description: family of Hmông flutes

name: hotchiku
description: The hotchiku is a Japanese end-blown bamboo flute.

name: hue puruhau (Māori taonga pūoro large bass gourd)
description: large gourd (hue) with no finger-holes, it is blown like a jug and has a booming bass sound.

name: hulusi
description: The hulusi is a Chinese free reed wind instrument which has three bamboo pipes which pass through a gourd.

name: Irish flute (19th century transverse flute)
description: wooden flute of the simple-system type, popular in Irish folk music

name: jug
description: an empty jug (usually made of glass or stoneware) played with the mouth

name: k'lông pút (Vietnamese Air Xylophone)
description: Played by manipulating the airstream through bamboo pipes using cupping and clapping, this Vietnamesian "Air Xylophone" was traditionally played in the rice-field.

name: kagurabue (bamboo transverse flute)
description: traditional six holed bamboo flute used in Gagaku no Kagaku

name: kaval
description: The kaval is a chromatic end-blown flute from the Balkans and Anatolia.

name: kèn bầu
description: The kèn bầu is a double reed instrument from Vietnam.

name: kèn lá
description: The kèn lá is an instrument used by the Hmong minority of Vietnam which consists of a leaf which is curled up and positioned in the mouth so it vibrates when it is blown.

name: keyed brass instruments
description: Keyed brass instruments use holes along the body of the instrument in a similar way to a woodwind instrument.

name: khèn Mèo
description: The khèn Mèo is a mouth organ used by the Hmong people. It has bamboo pipes (typically six) which each have a free reed.

name: khene
description: The khene is a mouth organ from Laos and north-east Thailand which is also used by some ethnic minority groups in Vietnam. It typically consists of 14 bamboo pipes arranged into two rows which are connected to a small, hollowed-out hardwood windchest.

name: khlui
description: The khlui is a vertical duct flute from Thailand which is generally made of bamboo.

name: ki pah
description: cow horns without fingerholes. with mouthpiece and free reed

name: kōauau (Māori taonga pūoro small cross-blown flute)
description: cross-blown flute made of stone, bone or wood. It is 10 to 39 cm long, with usually 3, but everything from none to 5 holes is known.

name: kōauau ponga ihu (Māori taonga pūoro tiny gourd nose flute)
description: nose flute made of gourd with it two holes, while it is tiny, it has a huge sound

name: kortholt
description: The kortholt is a woodwind instrument that was popular in the Renaissance period.

name: launeddas
description: The launeddas is a typical Sardinian woodwind instrument, consisting of three pipes.

name: limbe
description: The limbe is a Mongolian transverse flute.

name: melodica (Free-reed keyboard mouth-organ)
description: Popular as a musical education tool, it is usually made of plastic with a keyboard, its free-reed mouthpiece can also have an optional air tube. It has many brandnames.

name: mijwiz (twin bamboo single reed pipe)
description: Played using circular breathing, it is made of twin bamboo reeds with five to six holes. From the middle-east, it is used in traditional music and as a accompaniment to belly dancing and dabke.

name: mirliton
description: Mirliton is a generic term for membranophones played by a performer speaking or singing into them, and which alter the sound of the voice by means of a vibrating membrane.

name: mouth organ
description: A mouth organ is a generic term for free reed aerophone with one or more air chambers fitted with a free reed.

name: nabal
description: The nabal is a long, straight brass horn used in Korean traditional music.

name: nadaswaram
description: The nadaswaram is a South Indian double reed wind instrument.

name: nai
description: Nai, Romanian Panflute

name: natural brass instruments
description: Natural brass instruments only play notes in the instrument's harmonic series.

name: natural horn (Valveless and keyless ancestor of the modern horn)
description: Ancestor of the modern horn, it consists of a coiled tubing with a large flared bell. Bugles, posthorns and hunting horns are all natural horns

name: natural trumpet (Valveless ancestor of the modern trumpet)
description: Ancestor of the modern trumpet, it is valveless with a mouthpiece and at-least one coil, it has an origin in military use.

name: ney
description: Persian / Turkish / Arabic end-blown flute with five or six finger holes and one thumb hole.

name: nguru (Māori taonga pūoro small vessel flute)
description: Small vessel flute made of wood, clay, bone or soft stone like soapstone, it has 4 holes and is played with the nose or mouth.

name: nohkan
description: The nohkan is a high-pitched bamboo transverse flute from Japan.

name: Northumbrian pipes
description: Northumbrian (small)pipes

name: nose flute
description: The nose flute is a flute played by the nose commonly found in countries in and around the Pacific.

name: nose whistle
description: The nose whistle (also known as the Humanatone) is a simple instrument played with the nose. The stream of air is directed over an edge in the instrument and the frequency of the notes produced is controlled by the volume of air.

name: oboe
description: Oboe (soprano)

name: oboe d'amore
description: Oboe d'amore / Oboe d'amour (mezzo-soprano)

name: oboe da caccia
description: The oboe da caccia is a double reed woodwind instrument in the oboe family, pitched a fifth below the oboe and used primarily in the Baroque period of European classical music.

name: ocarina
description: The ocarina is a type of vessel flute which has a mouthpiece extending from the body.

name: olifant (Ivory natural brass hunting horn)
description: Hunting horn carved out of ivory, it was widely used in Medieval wars to alarm or increase soldiers' morale.

name: pang gu ly hu hmông
description: a kind of a "slide whistle" form. Hmông flute

name: pi
description: Pi is a family of quadruple reed oboes from Thailand.

name: pi nai
description: The pi nai is a type of pi normally used in the piphat ensemble.

name: pí thiu
description: Pí thiu or Pí khui vertical flute

name: piccolo oboe
description: The piccolo oboe is the smallest and highest pitched member of the oboe family.

name: piri
description: The piri is a Korean double reed instrument made of bamboo, used in both the folk and classical (court) music of Korea. Related to the Chinese guan and Japanese hichiriki.

name: pocket trumpet
description: The pocket trumpet is a compact size B♭ trumpet, with the same playing range as the regular trumpet.

name: poi āwhiowhio (Māori taonga pūoro swung whistling gourd)
description: A hollowed out gourd (hue) with one to three holes, swung around creating a whistling, chattering sound that resembled birds

name: porotiti (Māori taonga pūoro humming discs)
description: Whirring, spinning disks of many shapes, sizes and materials. When blown on, they also create a well of different humming sounds.

name: pōrutu (Māori taonga pūoro two harmonic flute)
description: A longer version of the kōauau, it is from 30-40 cm up towards 60 cm in length and often made of bone and hardwoods such as porokaiwhiria, mataī and tutu.

name: post horn
description: The post horn is a valveless coiled brass instrument used to signal the arrival or departure of a post rider or mail coach.

name: practice chanter
description: Looks like a recorder, but with double reeds and bagpipe fingering system. Mostly used to learn how to play the pipes, but are occasionally played in their own right.

name: pūkaea (Māori taonga pūoro wooden announcement trumpet)
description: Up to 2,5 meters long, this wooden trumpet was used for a variety of announcements like war, welcoming people and kumara planting.

name: pūmotomoto (Māori taonga pūoro long one-holed flute)
description: Long wooden flute with a notched open top and a single finger hole near the end.

name: pūpakapaka (Māori taonga pūoro long necked conch trumpet)
description: A pūtātara with a long wooden mouth piece, it has a deeper timbre than the pūtātara

name: pūtātara (Māori taonga pūoro conch shell trumpet)
description: Trumpet made of conch shell, it has a beautifully carved wooden mouthpiece. It was for signalling, but also ceremonial and ritual use.

name: pūtōrino (Māori taonga pūoro wooden dual-voiced flute)
description: Made of wood and shaped after the casemoth cocoon, it can be played as both a flute (female voice) and a trumpet (male voice).

name: quena
description: The quena is a traditional bamboo flute from the Andes.

name: rauschpfeife
description: A wooden double-reed instrument with a conical bore from the 16th and 17th centuries

name: reed organ
description: having pedals attached to bellows with reeds. sound is produced by playing the keyboard.

name: regal (Portable bellowed reed organ)
description: Popular in the renaissance, it was small and portable with two bellows and brass reeds.

name: rehu (Māori taonga pūoro long flute)
description: Made of wood like mataī or tutu, this long flute has a transverse blowing hole with a fipple like European flutes but finger holes in the style of the traditional pōrutu.

name: renaissance rackett (Renaissance era compact double reed)
description: Originating 1590 or earlier and made of wood or ivory, it had nine parallel cylindrical bores joined up at the top and bottom creating a continuous bore like a curled up snake. Its reed is attached to a center pirouette.

name: rondador
description: The rondador is a set of chorded bamboo panpipes from Ecuador.

name: ryuteki
description: The ryuteki is a Japanese transverse flute used in gagaku.

name: saduk
description: A cross between a saxophone and a duduk invented and played by Alexander Berne

name: samba whistle
description: The samba whistle is a tri-tone whistle used in samba music and other Brazilian music styles.

name: saó ôi flute
description: saó ôi (flute of the Muong)

name: sáo trúc
description: The sáo trúc is a Vietnamese transverse flute made of bamboo.

name: sarrusophone
description: The sarrusophone is a family of transposing musical instruments, intended to serve as a replacement in wind bands for the oboe and bassoon.

name: Schwyzerörgeli
description: The Schwyzerörgeli is a type of diatonic button accordion used in Swiss folk music.

name: Scottish smallpipes
description: Like (and developed from) the Northumbrian smallpipes, but with Great Highland Bagpipe fingering.

name: shakuhachi
description: The shakuhachi is a Japanese end-blown flute.

name: shawm
description: Shawm, Medieval and Renaissance instrument, predecessor to the oboe

name: shehnai
description: The shehnai is a double reed conical oboe, common in North India, West India and Pakistan, made out of wood, with a metal flare bell at the end.

name: sheng
description: The sheng is a Chinese free reed instrument consisting of a number of vertical pipes.

name: shinobue
description: The shinobue is a high-pitched transverse bamboo flute from Japan.

name: sho
description: The shō is a Japanese free reed instrument modelled on the Chinese sheng, although the shō tends to be smaller in size.

name: shruti box
description: The shruti box is similar to a harmonium and is used to provide a drone accompaniment.

name: siku
description: The siku is a traditional Andean panpipe.

name: slide brass instruments
description: Slide brass instruments use a slide to change the length of tubing.

name: slide whistle
description: Slide whistle (infamous 'Clangers' sound)

name: sopilka
description: Sopilka (generally) refers to a type of fife used in Ukrainian traditional music.

name: spilåpipa
description: The spilåpipa is a Swedish fipple flute with eight finger-holes on the top, but no thumb-holes. It has a modal tuning.

name: suling
description: The suling is a bamboo flute from Southeast Asia.

name: suona
description: The suona is a Chinese shawm frequently used in the folk music of northern China.

name: Swedish bagpipes
description: Swedish bagpipes are a type of bagpipes from Sweden.

name: syrinx
description: Greek Panflute

name: taepyeongso
description: The taepyeongso is a Korean double reed wind instrument which has a conical wooden body with a metal mouthpiece and cup-shaped metal bell.

name: taragot
description: The taragot is a Turkish/Hungarian/Romanian reed instrument related to the saxophone and clarinet.

name: tarota (Wooden keyless shawm from Catalonia)
description: Traditional Catalan double reed of medieval origin. Used for cobla music in the 19th century, it mostly disappeared: current tarotas are a modern re-invention.

name: tenor trombone
description: The tenor trombone is a trombone pitched in B♭.

name: tenora (Catalonian double reed descendant of shawm)
description: Derived from the tenor shawm, it was independently developed in Catalonia by oboe player Andreu Turon in the 19th century. Made of ginjoler wood with a metal cone, it is used in the traditional Cobla and Sardana music.

name: theatre organ
description: Theatre organ, such as the Wurlitzer

name: three-hole pipe (european 11th century pipe)
description: Ancient pipe originating in Europe, with analogies all over the world, it is often combined with tabor drums.

name: tible (Catalan valved shawm used in cobla)
description: Catalan double-reed, created in the 19th Century by adding valves to the tarota. Used principally for cobla music.

name: tiêu
description: The tiêu is a Vietnamese end-blown flute related to the Chinese xiao.

name: Tonette (plastic fipple flute)
description: introduced in 1938, it was a popular American educational instrument.

name: tràm plè
description: a variant of the "Hmông flute". flute blowers lips enclose the blowing hole with the vibrating "free reed" inside

name: trắng jâu
description: trắng jâu bass form of trắng lu

name: trikiti (Basque button accordion)
description: Diatonic button accordion used in traditional Basque ensemble

name: tromboon
description: The tromboon is an instrument created by attaching the reed of a bassoon to the body of a trombone.

name: tubax
description: The tubax is a modified saxophone which is more compact due to the tubing being folded more times.

name: tungso (Korean notched end-blown bamboo flute)
description: Made of thick aged bamboo, this notched end-blown flute may have had a buzzing membrane.

name: txistu (Basque fipple flute)
description: Fipple flute that became a symbol for the Basque folk revival.

name: valved brass instruments
description: Valved brass instruments use a set of valves which introduce additional tubing into the instrument.

name: venu
description: The venu is a bamboo transverse flute used in the Carnatic music of South India.

name: vessel flute
description: A vessel flute is a type of flute with an enclosed rather than cylindrical body.

name: vibrandoneon (accordina with piano keys)
description: wood accordina with piano keys invented in Italy

name: Vienna horn
description: The Vienna horn is a type of musical horn used primarily in Vienna, Austria, for playing orchestral or classical music.

name: vuvuzela (plastic horn)
description: plastic horn often used at football matches in South Africa

name: whistle (small, simple, singletoned flute)
description: simple, often single-toned and round-bodied whistle often used for regulation (sport, traffic, ...).

name: wot
description: The wot is a circular panpipe from Laos and the Isan region of northeastern Thailand.

name: Xaphoon
description: The Xaphoon is a keyless chromatic single-reed woodwind instrument.

name: xiao (Chinese end-blown flute)
description: Ancient Chinese vertical, end-blown flute made of bamboo

name: xun
description: The xun is a vessel flute from China which has a blowing hole at the top.

name: żaqq
description: The żaqq is a Maltese bagpipe made from the complete skin of an animal (typically a premature calf, goat or dog). The chanter consists of two side-by-side pipes and a bull's horn is normally attached to the end.

name: zhaleika
description: The zhaleika is a single reed hornpipe from Russia.

name: 17-string bass koto
description: A koto with 17 rather than 13 strings, sometimes described as a bass koto.

name: acoustic fretless guitar
description: Acoustic guitar without frets.

name: ajaeng
description: The ajaeng is a bowed Korean zither with 7 (sometimes 8 or 9) strings.

name: alto viol (Alto member of the viol family)
description: Alt, alto or contralto member of the viol family. Not to be confused with the Viola of the violin family, known as "Alto" in French.

name: alto violin (Alto or vertical violin, for French "alto" credits, choose viola)
description: Tuned the same as the viola but larger in size, it is played upright like the cello.

name: archlute
description: The archlute is a European plucked string instrument developed around 1600 as a compromise between the very large theorbo and the Renaissance tenor lute

name: archtop guitar
description: An archtop guitar is a steel-stringed acoustic or semi-acoustic guitar with a distinctive arched top, which is particularly popular with jazz players.

name: arpeggione (bass viol with guitar frets and tuning)
description: Invented in 1823, it had a body like a medieval fiddle, but had frets and tuning like the guitar.

name: bajo sexto
description: The bajo sexto is a Mexican string instrument with 12 strings in 6 double courses.

name: bandora
description: Although originally built like a cittern, its 6-7 courses of strings were tuned more like a lute.

name: bandura (Ukraininan lute-zither)
description: Large box lute-zither with a short, unfretted neck. It has 30 or more strings fanned out on the body, the four to eight bass strings are strung to the neck.

name: banhu (northern coconut huqin)
description: The banhu is a Chinese bowed string instrument in the huqin family. It is also called banghu for its use in bangzi opera.

name: banjitar
description: The banjitar is a six-string banjo with the neck of a guitar.

name: banjo-ukulele (banjo ukulele hybrid)
description: small fretted hybrid instrument with a banjo body and a ukulele neck, popular in the 1920-30

name: banjolin (banjo and mandolin/violin hybrid)
description: reinvented several times in different lands, it combines banjo body and neck of mandolin, it is tuned like it and the violin.

name: barbat (ancient asian/persian lute)
description: ancient central asian/persian string instrument ancestor of the iranian oud. it was an important instrument in pre-islamic iran and persia. the current "Persian barbat" is more similar to the oud

name: baroque guitar
description: Predecessor of the modern classical guitar, it had gut strings and even gut frets. First described in 1555, it surpassed the Renaissance lute's popularity.

name: baryton (Bowed with pluckable strings)
description: Hybrid between the viol and the bandora, it has an extra set of plucked strings in addition to the bowed ones. Used regularly in Europe until the end of the 18th century.

name: bass guitar
description: Bass (modern, typically electrical, but not always)

name: bass viol (Bass member of the viol family)
description: Most common viol member today, it was the bass-range viol in the original consort.

name: bass violin (Sixteenth century precursor of the (violon)cello)
description: Sixteenth century predecessor of the violoncello, it was fretless with f-holes and had at first three, then later four, strings tuned in fifths.

name: berda (begeš, large bass serbo-croatian plucked stringinstrument)
description: Bass member of the Serbo-Croatian tamburica orchestra, it is contrabass like. it has four thick metal strings

name: bhapang (Rajasthani string membranophone)
description: Originating in Mewati community of Rahajastan, India, it is traditionally made of gourd with top and bottom cut of with a goat hide membrane nailed to one opening and a gut string which ends in a bamboo piece attached to the membrane. The instrument is held in the armpit and played by plucking the string while pulling the it.

name: bisernica (prim, small serbo-croatian plucked stringinstrument)
description: smallest member of the Serbo-Croatian tamburica orchestra, it is usually the lead or "prim" instrument. it can either have one double string and three single strings (prim/bisernica) or two double strings and two single strings (bisernica)

name: biwa
description: The biwa is a short-necked Japanese fretted lute which is played with a large triangular-shaped plectrum.

name: Blaster Beam (long metal bar with strings)
description: Very long metal bar fitted with strings and electric pickups, it makes a deep ominous booming sound and is often used in score.

name: bolon
description: The bolon is a traditional harp-lute played in several African countries.

name: bouzar / gouzouki (hybrid of bouzouki and guitar)
description: guitar-bouzouki hybrid with guitar body and 4 pairs of strings like the bouzouki, developed separately several different luthiers, among them Stefan Sobell (bouzar) and Davy Stuart (gouzouki)

name: bowed piano
description: A piano whose strings are bowed, using nylon filament or other materials

name: brač (basprim, serbo-croatian plucked stringinstrument)
description: second smallest member of the Serbo-Croatian tamburica orchestra, there are often two, first and second bass. it can either have three double strings or two double strings and three single strings

name: bugarija (kontra, serbo-croatian plucked stringinstrument)
description: chord rhythm member of the Serbo-Croatian tamburica orchestra, it is guitar like. it has one double string D and three single strings

name: bulbul tarang
description: The bulbul tarang is a string instrument from India and Pakistan.

name: buzuq
description: The buzuq is a long-necked fretted lute related to the Greek bouzouki and Turkish saz which is associated with the music of Lebanon and Syria.

name: cavaquinho
description: The cavaquinho is a small plucked string instrument of Portuguese origin with four wire or gut strings

name: cello
description: also know as violoncello

name: čelo (čelović or csello, counter serbo-croatian plucked stringinstrument)
description: counterpoint member of the Serbo-Coatian tamburica orchestra, it is guitar like like the bugarija. it can either have two double strings and two single strings (čelović) or now four single strings are more common. (čelo/čelović/) the čelović is a different pitch than the čelo

name: chakhe
description: The chakhe is a three stringed crocodile shaped plucked zither from Thailand.

name: chanzy
description: The chanzy is a three-stringed Tuvan lute.

name: charango
description: The charango is a small South American lute.

name: chikuzen biwa
description: The chikuzen biwa is a biwa with either four strings and frets or five strings and frets popularised during the Meiji period.

name: chitarra battente (Italian strumming 17th century guitar)
description: Developed chiefly as a folk instrument for accompanying singing and dancing, its front has a intricately carved soundhole and slants towards the bottom where the 5 double (sometimes triple courses) of thin steel strings are fastened with pins. The back can be rounded or flat.

name: chitra veena
description: The chitra veena is a 20 or 21-string fretless lute in Carnatic music.

name: chuurqin (ancient predecessor of the Morin khuur)
description: Counter-trapezoid shaped Mongolian fiddle, it is the ancestor of the Morin khuur

name: citole
description: The citole is an archaic musical instrument, similar and a distant ancestor of the modern guitar.

name: cizhonghu (large huqin)
description: The dahu, also known as cizhonghu or xiaodihu, is a large Chinese bowed string instrument in the huqin family.

name: classical kemençe
description: Turkish bowl-shaped kemenche, mainly used in classical Ottoman music

name: cò ke
description: The cò ke is an instrument used by the Mường ethnic minority in Vietnam. It is similar to the đàn nhị, consisting of a cylindrical wooden soundbox covered in snakeskin and two strings which are played with a horsehair bow.

name: craviola (guitar/Viola caipira like plucked string instrument)
description: Distinctly asymmetric in contrast to typical guitar, its timbre is a combination of the harpsichord (pt:cravo) and the Viola caipira. It can have six or twelve nylon or steel strings and are produced solely by company Giannini.

name: Cretan lyra
description: The Cretan lyra is a Greek pear-shaped, three-stringed bowed musical instrument, central to the traditional music of Crete and parts of Greece.

name: cuatro
description: A class of South-American guitars

name: cümbüş (Turkish oud like)
description: created by Zeynel Abidin who name himself after the instrument, it's a banjolin like modern Turkish instrument

name: đàn bầu
description: The đàn bầu is a one-stringed Vietnamese zither.

name: đàn nguyệt
description: The đàn nguyệt or đàn kìm is a two-stringed Vietnamese lute with a long neck and a circular, flat body.

name: đàn nhị
description: The đàn nhị is a Vietnamese stringed instrument with a small, cylindrical body, covered at one end with snakeskin. The bow passes between the two strings and the instrument has no frets. This instrument is of Chinese descent but has relatives all over Asia.

name: đàn tam
description: The đàn tam is a three-stringed fretless lute from Vietnam.

name: đàn tam thập lục
description: The đàn tam thập lục is a relatively recent imported addition to Vietnamese instruments. A dulcimer with thirty-six strings, struck with two small rubber-clad dubs. It has many counterparts in various countries, such as the "santoor" in India and also the "cimbalon" in Hungary.

name: đàn tranh
description: The đàn tranh is a a long Vietnamese zither with sixteen strings and high, movable bridges. The strings are plucked with plectrums, while the left hand is used for ornamenting the notes by pressing the strings.

name: đàn tứ
description: The đàn tứ or đàn đoản is a traditional Vietnamese moon-shaped lute with a short neck.

name: đàn tứ dây
description: A latter-day construction in the form of a four-stringed, square-bodied bass guitar

name: đàn tỳ bà
description: The đàn tỳ bà is a four-stringed Vietnamese lute with a pear-shaped body. Like the Chinese pipa from which is derived, it has greatly elevated frets at the neck.

name: daruan (Bass ruan)
description: Bass member of Chinese ruan family of lutes.

name: diddley bow
description: The diddley bow is a single-stringed American instrument which is typically homemade. It consists of a single string of baling wire tensioned between two nails on a board over a glass bottle, which is used both as a bridge and as a means to magnify the instrument's sound.

name: dilruba
description: The dilruba is a bowed string instrument from Northern India, mostly used in religious music and light classical songs

name: diyingehu (bass gehu (huqin))
description: The diyingehu is a Chinese bowed string instrument, with four strings and tuned like the double bass.

name: djoza (ancient Iraqi bowed string instrument)
description: its origins can be sourced almost 5000 years ago, this Iraqi string instrument is the forefather of several instruments around the world. Its name means coconut or acorn, while originally made of walnut, it is today of coconut and fish-skin or heart-membrane.

name: dobro
description: Dobro, resonator guitar

name: dolceola
description: A dolceola is a musical instrument resembling a miniature piano, but which is in fact a zither with a keyboard.

name: dombra
description: The dombra is a long-necked lute from central Asia.

name: domra
description: The domra is a long-necked Russian string instrument of the lute family with a round body and three or four metal strings.

name: donso ngɔni
description: Six-stringed lute-harp from Wassoulou, West Africa. Traditionally played by hunters, its resonator box is made of calabash covered by animal skin.

name: doshpuluur
description: The doshpuluur is a long-necked Tuvan lute.

name: double bass (Contrabass of modern violin family)
description: Known also as contrabass or upright bass, it is the largest and lowest-pitched member of the modern violin family, it is a principal member of the symphony orchestra.

name: dramyin
description: The dramyin is a traditional Himalayan long-necked lute with seven strings.

name: dulce melos
description: A European mediaeval struck string instrument, similar to the psaltery and a possible ancestor of the piano. Essentially it is a dulcimer with keys.

name: dutar
description: The dutar is a long-necked two-stringed lute found in Iran and Central Asia.

name: duxianqin
description: The duxianqin is a one-string zither which is likely derived from the Vietnamese đàn bầu.

name: ektara
description: The ektara is a one-string instrument used in traditional music from Bangladesh, India, Egypt, and Pakistan.

name: electric fretless guitar
description: Electric guitar without frets.

name: erhu (Middle range huqin)
description: The erhu is a bowed Chinese instrument with two strings.

name: esraj
description: The esraj is a bowed string instrument from Eastern and Central India, mostly used as an accompanying instrument

name: five-string banjo
description: A five-string banjo is a banjo with five strings.

name: flamenco guitar (Guitar used in flamenco)
description: Deriving from the classical guitar, it has many modifications and playing techniques to create a more percussive sound. Originally having wooden tuning pegs like lutes and violins, it has a thinner, lighter build with "golpeadores" or tapping-plates and less sustain than the classical guitar.

name: four-string banjo
description: A four-string banjo is a banjo with four strings.

name: fretless bass
description: variety of bass guitars without frets

name: gaohu (High pitched huqin)
description: The gaohu is a Chinese bowed string instrument developed from the erhu and tuned a fourth higher.

name: gayageum
description: The gayageum is a traditional Korean zither-like string instrument which normally has 12 strings.

name: gehu (cello huqin)
description: The gehu is a Chinese bowed string instrument, with four strings and tuned like the cello.

name: geomungo
description: The geomungo is a traditional Korean zither, based on the Chinese guqin, which typically has 6 strings.

name: German harp
description: German/Bohemian harp

name: ghaychak (Perisan double-chambered bowl lute)
description: Having 4 metal strings, it is carved from a single piece of wood into a particular shape similar to the Sarinda, it has 3 soundholes, two on each side of the short neck and one under the bridge which is membrane-covered.

name: ģīga
description: The ģīga is a two-stringed bowed zither found in Latvia.

name: gittern (medieval lute-like guitar forerunner)
description: a medieval round-backed string instrument ancestral to the guitar

name: Gravikord (Modern 24-stringed stainless steel kora)
description: Based on the polyrhythm of the Afrikan kora, kalimba and Japanese koto, it is electro-acoustic with a stainless steel frame with 24 nylon strings and an integral piezoelectric sensor.

name: guitalele
description: The guitalele is a guitar-ukulele hybrid, combining the small size of a guitalele with the six strings of a classical guitar.

name: guitarrón chileno
description: The guitarrón chileno is a Chilean guitar-like plucked string instrument which typically has 25 strings.

name: guitarrón mexicano
description: The guitarrón mexicano is a very large and deep-bodied Mexican guitar-like instrument with six strings which is traditionally played in mariachi groups.

name: gumbri
description: The gumbri or sintir is a three-stringed skin-covered bass plucked lute from North Africa.

name: guqin
description: The guqin is a plucked seven-string Chinese musical instrument of the zither family.

name: gusli (Traditional Russian plucked psaltery)
description: Ancient Russian psaltery/box-zither with 4 to 36 metal strings, it is played in a few different ways, depending on the variation (see annotation). Originally similar to a flat harp, it was played at ceremonies and other festivities.

name: gut guitar (gut-stringed acoustic guitar)
description: Hollow-body acoustic guitar strung with gut-strings.

name: guzheng
description: The guzheng or zheng is a Chinese plucked zither, with 18 to 23 or more strings and movable bridges.

name: haegeum (Korean silk-string fiddle)
description: Widely used in Korea, it has a wood soundbox and a rod neck with two silk-strings, heldt on the knee while played with a bow

name: harp
description: The harp is a plucked string instrument consisting of multiple strings stretched across a vertical frame.

name: harp guitar
description: The harp guitar is a guitar-based string instrument with any number of additional unstopped strings which can accommodate individual plucking.

name: harpejji (Electric guitar-piano tapping instrument)
description: Effectively a small electric guitar-piano hybrid, it is played by tapping the multiple isometric arranged strings that are stretched over a long flat board.

name: heike biwa
description: The heike biwa is a biwa with four strings and five frets used to play Heike Monogatari.

name: igil
description: The igil is a Tuvan bowed string instrument with two strings.

name: Irish harp / clàrsach
description: An Irish/Scottish harp.

name: jeli ngɔni (West African four-stringed grigot lute)
description: Four-stringed banjo-like lute from West Africa, traditionally played by griots. Made of hollowed out wood with an animal hide as membrane.

name: jing'erhu (Beijing opera supporting erhu (huqin))
description: The jing'erhu is a Chinese bowed string instrument, similar to the erhu, so named because is played in Beijing opera.

name: jinghu (Beijing opera upmost small & high pitch huqin)
description: The jinghu is a Chinese bowed string instrument with two strings used primarily in Beijing opera.

name: jouhikko
description: The jouhikko is a traditional, 2 or 3 stringed bowed lyre, from Finland and Karelia.

name: kamalen ngɔni (modern ngoni made of calabash with more strings)
description: modern derivative of the donso ngɔni, it comes with more strings and is made of calabash, it became an important instrument in the rise of the Wassoulou music in the 80's and 90's

name: kamancheh
description: The kamānche is a Persian bowed string instrument.

name: kanklės (Traditional Lithuanian plucked psaltery)
description: Oldest instrument of Lithuania, it is made of a special tree in a trapezoid shape, it has a metalbar and wooden pegs at each side were 5 to 12 strings are strung.

name: kannel (Traditional Estonian plucked psaltery)
description: National symbol of Estonia, related to Finnish kantele. While traditionally a small instrument with 5 to 7 strings, some newer versions are much bigger, with up to 50 strings.

name: kantele (Traditional Finnish plucked psaltery)
description: Traditional and mythological psaltery of Finland, it comes in two versions; the oldest, a one piece bridge-less psaltery with 5 to 20 originally horsehair, later metal, strings and a modern "Concert" box-zither variant with a switch mechanism to alter the up to 40 strings sharps and flats.

name: kanun
description: Kanun, Arabic plucked strings

name: kemençe of the Black Sea
description: Turkish box-shaped kemenche, mainly used for folk music.

name: kemenche
description: Various types of stringed bowed musical instruments having their origin in the Eastern Mediterranean

name: khim
description: The khim is a hammered dulcimer from Thailand and Cambodia.

name: kokle (Traditional Latvian plucked psaltery)
description: Originating from 13th century Latvia, it is made of wood and have today nine to eleven, up to thirty-three strings tuned diatonically. Played horizontally on lap or table by plucking while muting chosen strings. Became in the 70's and 80's an important part of the folklore movement.

name: kokyu (Traditional Japanese bowed spikefiddle.)
description: Although similar to and introduced at the same time as the shamisen, it is unique to japan. With ebony neck and coconut body its three (rarely four) strings are played upright with a horsetail bow.

name: komuz
description: The komuz is a fretless string instrument used in Central Asian music, seen as the Kyrgyz national instrument.

name: koto
description: The koto is a traditional Japanese string instrument with 13 strings that are strung over 13 movable bridges along the width of the instrument.

name: krar
description: The krar is a five or six-stringed bowl-shaped lyre from Eritrea and Ethiopia.

name: laouto (Greek long-neck lute)
description: Differs from other lutes in that its string tension is greater thus sounding more like the oud. From ancient Greece, it was used as an accompaniment to Cretan Lyra

name: lap harp (simplified zither)
description: Used to teach children how to play, it is a simplified zither shaped like a trapezoid.

name: laúd (spanish plucked chordophone)
description: a spanish plucked cittern, it is also played in the spanish diaspora.

name: lavta
description: The lavta is a plucked string instrument from Greece and Turkey.

name: lirone
description: The lirone (or lira da gamba) is the bass member of the lira family, a bowed string instrument with between 9 and 16 strings and a fretted neck.

name: liuqin (Small pearshaped chinese lute)
description: Traditionally made of willow, it has four strings and a small, pear-shaped body. Played with a pick, it has a higher pitch than the pipa.

name: luthéal
description: The luthéal is a kind of hybrid piano which extends the register possibilities of a standard piano, created by Georges Cloetens

name: lyra viol (Small bass viol)
description: Small bass viol, specialised for intricate polyphonics, it had a flatter bridge than the other bass viols.

name: mandocello
description: The mandocello is a plucked string instrument of the mandolin family, the equivalent to the cello in the violin family

name: mandoguitar (mandolin / electric guitar hybrid)
description: unison course tuned 12 stringed electric guitar body with mandolin neck, it is tuned an octave higher than a conventional guitar, thus having the tonal range of the mandolin.

name: mandolute
description: A mandolute is a North African fretted string instrument which combines a traditional oud string format with five pairs of metal strings

name: mandora / gallichon (18th century bass lute)
description: Invented by European luthiers in the first half of the 18th century, it had 6 to 7 single or double courses of gut strings and a long neck with either sharp or shallow angled pegbox.

name: marxophone
description: A type of fretless zither.

name: Mexican vihuela
description: Mexican vihuela, used by mariachi bands

name: minipiano
description: The minipiano is a type of piano in which the sound producing mechanism is positioned below the keyboard, allowing an economical use of space.

name: morin khuur (traditional bowed Mongol fiddle)
description: Important to the Mongolians, it is trapezoid shaped with two traditionally horsehair, now often nylon, strings fastened by wooden pegs at the end which is carved like a horse head.

name: ngɔni
description: Plucked string instrument made of wood or gourd from West Africa.

name: njarka (Malian single string gourd-fiddle)
description: Made of goatskin covered dried gourd, it has a single gut string bowed with a horsehair bow.

name: nyatiti
description: The nyatiti is a five to eight-stringed plucked string instrument from Kenya.

name: nyckelharpa
description: The nyckelharpa is a traditional Swedish string instrument.

name: nylon guitar (nylon-stringed acoustic guitar)
description: Hollow-body acoustic guitar strung with nylon-strings.

name: octave mandolin
description: The octave mandolin is a fretted string instrument with four pairs of strings tuned in fifths, G, D, A, E (low to high), an octave below a mandolin.

name: octavilla (Spanish melody & strumming guitar)
description: Used in Spanish classic and popular music during the late 19th and early 20th century, it together with bandurria and laúd carried the melody in rondas and rondallas. It had six pairs of strings, tuned a fourth lower than bandurria, It fell out of use when contralto bandurria became common.

name: octavina (Filipino rondalla guitar)
description: Originating with the Spanish influence on Filipino culture, it has 14 strings and a short neck with 16 to 20 frets. It is played with its close relative, the laúd.

name: octobass (Extralarge 3-string Bass)
description: Constructed as the uttermost largest member of the violin family, it is up towards 4 meters and has three strings operated by levers and pedals.

name: oktawka
description: Small Polish traditional fiddle.

name: orpharion
description: A plucked instrument from the Renaissance.

name: orphica (late 18th century portable piano with shoulder strap)
description: portable piano with shoulder strap invented in 1795, it is a descendant of the Baroque Bauchladenspinett and a sort of early precursor of the keytar

name: oval spinet (late 17th century oval harpsichord)
description: more accurately a virginals, its strings were arranged in a pattern creating an oval shape, allowing for a stronger, more compact configuration. 2 examples survive today.

name: Paraguayan harp
description: The Paraguayan harp is a 32-48-string diatonic harp used in Paraguay and Venezuela.

name: pardessus de viole (Smallest member of the viol family)
description: Pardessus or sopranino member of the viol family

name: pedal piano
description: The pedal piano is a kind of piano that includes a pedalboard, enabling bass register notes to be played with the feet, as is standard on the organ.

name: piano spinet (small drop action piano)
description: small piano with drop action stickers manufactured from around 1930 to the early 1990s.

name: pipa (Pearshaped chinese lute)
description: Chinese pear-shaped plucked lute with four strings and 12 to 26 frets.

name: Portuguese guitar
description: The Portuguese guitar is a plucked string instrument associated with fado. It has twelve steel strings, strung in six courses.

name: prepared piano
description: A prepared piano is a piano that has had its sound altered by placing objects (preparations) between or on the strings or on the hammers or dampers.

name: ravanahatha
description: Ancient bowed fiddle, once popular in Western India and Sri Lanka.

name: rebec (Medieval bowed lyre)
description: pear shaped body made from a single piece of wood, this medieval bowed string-instrument originated as a Byzantian lyra like variant of the Arabic Rebab and was a possible influence to the violin.

name: ruan
description: Ruan is a family of Chinese plucked lutes.

name: rubab (Plucked lute member of the bowed rebab family)
description: Related to bowed instrument rebab, it is played in many countries, from India to Afghanistan. It's made of wood and covered with a membrane and has 3 melody strings, 3 drone strings and 11/12 resonance strings.

name: rudra veena
description: The rudra veena is a large plucked string instrument used in Hindustani classical music.

name: samica (solo serbo-croatian plucked lute)
description: also known as dangubica or kuterevka, it is similar to the bisernica and the ancestor of the entire tamburica ensemble. this plucked long-necked lute has two double strings and is played solo.

name: sanshin
description: The sanshin is an Okinawan string instrument which consists of a snakeskin-covered body, neck and three strings. It is traditionally played with a plectrum made of horn worn on the index finger.

name: santoor
description: Santoor, Indian dulcimer

name: santur
description: Santur, Middle Eastern

name: sanxian
description: The sanxian is a Chinese lute with three strings.

name: sarangi
description: The sarangi is a short-necked, bowed string instrument from India, Nepal and Pakistan.

name: Saraswati veena
description: The Saraswati veena is an Indian plucked stringed instrument used in Carnatic music.

name: šargija
description: The šargija is a long necked plucked lute used in the folk music of the Balkans.

name: sasando (Indonesian tube zither)
description: Made of palmyra leaves that act as a resonator and a bamboo-tube stuck with wooden pegs where the plucked strings are attached, this traditional Indonesian instrument has an important place in folk history. It is still being used and modernised.

name: satsuma biwa
description: The satsuma biwa is a biwa with four strings and frets popularised during the Edo period.

name: saw duang
description: The saw duang is a two-stringed instrument used in traditional Thai music which has a cylindrical soundbox made of wood and a snakeskin resonator.

name: saw sam sai
description: The saw sam sai is a three-stringed bowed instrument from Thailand.

name: saw u
description: The saw u is a Thai bowed string instrument which has a soundbox made from a coconut shell with a cowskin resonator.

name: saz
description: The saz is a long-necked fretted lute

name: setar
description: The setar is a long-necked three-stringed lute found in Iran and Central Asia.

name: shamisen
description: The shamisen, samisen or sangen is a three-stringed instrument from Japan which is played with a large triangular-shaped plectrum called a bachi. The body traditionally uses cat or dog skin, unlike the Chinese sanxian and Okinawan sanshin.

name: shichepshin
description: The shichepshin is a traditional bowed string instrument of the Circassian peoples.

name: shudraga
description: The shudraga is a Mongolian fretless lute with three strings.

name: sitar
description: The sitar is a plucked stringed instrument used mainly in Hindustani music and Indian classical music which is descended from a similar but simpler Persian instrument called the setar.

name: soprano violin
description: Tuned a fourth above and about three quarters the size of a standard violin.

name: spinet (A smaller harpsichord, strings at an angle)
description: A smaller harpsichord, often with the strings at 30 degrees from the keyboard.

name: spinettone (extralong spinet with deep bass register)
description: Exceptionally long spinet, with multiple strings choirs, its bass-tones were produced by longer, not thicker strings.

name: steel-string guitar
description: The steel-string guitar is a modern form of acoustic guitar that is strung with steel strings.

name: Stroh violin
description: The Stroh violin is a violin with a metal resonator and horn rather than a wooden body.

name: suka
description: The suka is a once-extinct fiddle from Poland.

name: sursingar (large lute-sarod from India)
description: used in the Hindustani style Dhrupad music, it has steel and bronze strings and is played with a metal pick.

name: swarmandal
description: The swarmandal is an Indian zither.

name: tack piano
description: The tack piano is a permanently altered version of an ordinary piano, which has tacks or nails placed on the felt-padded hammers of the instrument at the point where the hammers hit the strings, giving the instrument a tinny, more percussive sound.

name: taishogoto
description: The taishōgoto is a Japanese string instrument with 2-12 strings and keys which are used to fret the strings.

name: talharpa
description: The talharpa is a four-stringed bowed lyre from northern Europe, mostly played in Estonia.

name: tambura (Macedonian/Bulgarian long-necked lute)
description: do not confuse with: Serb-Croat "tamburica" ensemble. Persian/Turkish ancient things evolved/came from "tanbur". unrelated Indian drone "tanpura" related Indian "pandour"

name: tanbur (Persian/Turkish ancient long-necked lute)
description: the ancient ancestor of many related lute like instruments.

name: tanpura (Indian drone long-necked lute)
description: Usually accompanying sitar on ragas, the fretless instrument comes in different sizes: largest; male-voice, smaller; female-voice and smallest; the instrument-accompanying "tanpuri"

name: tar (lute)
description: The tar is a long-necked, waisted lute found in Azerbaijan, Iran, Armenia, Georgia, and other areas near the Caucasus region. Not to be confused with the drum of the same name.

name: te kū (Māori taonga pūoro single string bow)
description: also just "kū", a mouthbow with a single string, struck with a light implement of bone or wood.

name: tenor banjo
description: A tenor banjo is a four-string banjo with tenor tuning, usually C G D A.

name: tenor guitar
description: Slightly smaller, four-string version of the steel-string acoustic guitar or electric guitar

name: tenor viol (Tenor member of the viol family)
description: Tenor member of the viol family

name: tenor violin
description: Tuned an octave below the traditional violin and at about half the size of the cello, it has a range between the cello and the viola. It has a longer neck and thinner ribs than the cello.

name: theorbo (Extended necked many-stringed lute)
description: Developed as an extended range bass-lute in Italy during the late sixteenth century, it has an extended neck with a second pegbox.

name: tololoche
description: The tololoche is a traditional musical instrument from northern Mexico, similar but smaller than the European double bass.

name: tonkori
description: The tonkori is a plucked string instrument played by the Ainu of northern Japan and Sakhalin.

name: topshuur
description: The topshuur is a two-stringed lute from Mongolia and Tuva.

name: treble viol (Treble/descant member of the viol family)
description: The treble, descant or soprano member of the viol family

name: treble violin (Smallest member of the new violin family)
description: Tuned an octave above and about quarter the size of the traditional violin.

name: tromba marina
description: A tromba marina is a triangular bowed string instrument used in medieval and Renaissance Europe that consists of a body and neck in the shape of a truncated cone resting on a triangular base.

name: tumbi
description: The tumbi is a high pitched, single string plucking instrument associated with folk music of Punjab.

name: ukeke
description: The ukeke is a Hawaiian musical bow made of koa wood, 16 to 24 inches long and about 1½ inches wide with two or three strings fastened through and around either end, tuned to an A major triad.

name: ukulele
description: The ukulele is a small guitar-like instrument commonly associated with Hawaiian music. It generally has four nylon or gut strings.

name: ütőgardon
description: The ütőgardon is a folk musical instrument played primarily in Transylvania. It is similar in appearance to a cello, but played percussively like a drum. Instead of being played with a bow, its strings are plucked and beaten with a stick.

name: valiha
description: The valiha is a bamboo tube zither from Madagascar

name: vichitra veena
description: The vichitra veena is a plucked string instrument used in Hindustani music.

name: Vietnamese guitar
description: The Vietnamese guitar is similar to a normal guitar, but with scalloped fingerboard resulting in elevated frets similar to the đàn nguyệt.

name: viola caipira (Brazilian música caipira guitar)
description: Used in folk-music, It has ten steel strings in five courses.

name: viola d'amore (Baroque fretless similar to both viols and violins.)
description: While it is fretless and played like the violins "a la braccia", it has a flat back, c-holes and sloping shoulders like a viol. From the baroque period, it has up to 14 strings.

name: viola da gamba (Generic member of the viol family, Use for "Viol" Credits)
description: The Generic member of the viol family, use it for "Viol" credits, most viola da gamba credits are however the Bass Viol

name: violino piccolo
description: The violino piccolo is a stringed instrument of the baroque period. Most examples are similar to a child's size violin in size and are tuned a third or a fourth higher.

name: viololyra (cretan lyra / violin hybrid)
description: Inspired by the violin in 1920, Hellenic luthiers combined parts of the old Cretan lyra with the violin.

name: violoncello piccolo (for violoncello use "cello")
description: The violoncello piccolo is a Baroque string instrument which is between the viola and cello in size and typically has five strings.

name: violone (Contra/double-bass member of the viol family)
description: Violone, The largest/deepest member of the Viol family

name: virginal
description: The virginals is a smaller and simpler rectangular form of the harpsichord with only one string per note

name: yangqin
description: The yangqin is a Chinese hammered dulcimer.

name: yatga
description: The yatga is a traditional Mongolian plucked zither, similar to the Chinese guzheng.

name: yaylı tanbur (Turkish bowed lute)
description: The yaylı tanbur is a bowed lute from Turkey derived from the older plucked tanbur.

name: yehu (southern coconut huqin)
description: The yehu is a Chinese bowed string instrument in the huqin family, made from a coconut shell.

name: yoochin (Mongolian wire-stringed hammered dulcimer)
description: Originally introduced to Mongolia from China, it has 13 double wire-strings and a black lacquered wooden soundboard. Traditionally it was only played by townspeople.

name: yueqin (Traditional Chinese lute)
description: It has a short fretted neck originally with four silk but now usually nylon or steel strings, and large flat round body, earning it the nickname "moon lute"

name: zhonghu (Alto huqin)
description: The zhonghu is a Chinese bowed string instrument developed from the erhu and tuned a fourth or a fifth lower.

name: zhongruan
description: The zhongruan is a Chinese plucked lute, the tenor-ranged size in the ruan family.

name: zhuihu (Wooden huqin)
description: Originating from Henan province, this fretless huqin has the accustomary two strings, but is made of wood.

name: afoxé
description: The afoxé is a Brazilian instrument typically consisting of a gourd wrapped in a beaded net.

name: agogô
description: The agogô is a single or multiple bell used in samba music with origins in traditional Yoruba music.

name: akete (set of Nyabinghi drums)
description: three-parts drumset (baandu, funde, and kete) commonly used in Burru and Nyabinghi musics.

name: alfaia
description: The alfaia is a Brazilian cylindrical drum.

name: amadinda
description: Amadinda, southern Uganda giant xylophone, made on with resonating hardwood bars

name: aman khuur (mongolian jew's harp)
description: there are two types: temür/tömör khuur (steel) and khulsan khuur (bamboo)

name: anvil
description: The anvil is a tool normally used by blacksmiths which is sometimes used as a percussion instrument.

name: ashiko (cone shaped west african frame-drum)
description: conical goatskin frame-drum originating with the Yoruba people of West Africa, it is also found in Afro-Caribbean and Afro-Latin American cultures.

name: atabaque
description: The atabaque is a tall Brazilian hand drum.

name: atarigane
description: The atarigane is a Japanese gong which is struck using a deer horn mallet.

name: baandu (Nyabinghi bass drum)
description: larger bass drum also known as thunder or pope smasher, it has a double goat skin membrane and is hit with a padded mallet. Important in the Jamaican Burru music and Rastafari movement, it is part of the Nyabinghi/Akete drums.

name: balafon
description: Balafon, Malian 'gourd xylophone'

name: bangu
description: The bangu or danpigu is a Chinese frame drum, struck by two bamboo sticks. It is usually played along with the clappers ban (Chinese: 板, bǎn) and both instruments are known collectively as guban (Chinese: 鼓板, gǔbǎn).

name: Batá drum
description: A Batá drum is a double-headed drum originating from Nigeria.

name: bell tree
description: A bell tree is a percussion instrument, consisting of vertically nested inverted metal bowls.

name: bells
description: Cup or bellshaped bells, these are shuk or struck.

name: bendir
description: Bendir, frame drum from North Africa, doesn't have jingles

name: bicycle bell
description: Bell as found on bicycles, sound is made by internal spring loaded hammer, not unlike alarm-clock.

name: bin-sasara
description: The binzasara is a Japanese percussion instrument made of many small slats of wood connected by a spine of string with handles at each end.

name: body percussion
description: Percussion performed by parts of the body.

name: bones (Folk music idiophone)
description: Made of bone or wood, these are paired sticks of sonorous material used in folk music.

name: boobam (arrangement of bamboo tube-drums)
description: Pipes of bamboo with goat or calfskin membranes, the pitches depend largely on tube-lenght, it is the ancestor to the octoban. Modern variants are usually made of wood, plastic or metal with plastic membranes.

name: buk
description: The buk is a Korean drum. While buk is a generic term for drum, it normally refers to a shallow barrel-shaped drum with a wooden body.

name: caixa (Brazilian Samba snare-drum)
description: Traditionally used in samba and maracatu, it originates from the European military battalion. It is made of a 30-35 cm diameter metal barrel strung with a synthetic material, upon which a steel wire or guitar string is strung across.

name: cajón
description: Cajón, Peruvian box drum

name: calabash
description: An African percussion instrument, made of a dried gourd plant. Struck with hands or objects.

name: castanets (Pair of concave shells)
description: Pair of concave wood, bone, shell or even fibreglass shells, they are combined by a string and are often used by dancers.

name: caxixi
description: The caxixi is a shaker originating in Brazil which is made of a small wicker basket containing seeds or other small particles.

name: çevgen
description: A pole with bells and/or zills used in the traditional Ottoman military bands

name: chacha
description: Chacha, west Indian rattle

name: chande
description: The chande is a drum used in the traditional and classical music of South India.

name: chap
description: Chap are a pair of cymbals used in Thai and Cambodian music. They are larger, flatter and thinner than the cymbals known as ching.

name: chau gong
description: The chau gong is a large gong made of brass or bronze which is almost flat except for the rim.

name: chime bar
description: A chime bar is a percussion instrument consisting of a tuned metal bar similar to a glockenspiel bar which is mounted on a wooden resonator and played with a mallet.

name: chimes
description: Bar or pole shaped chimes, usually arranged in a line or circle, hanging free or struck with mallets.

name: ching
description: Ching are a pair of small hand cymbals used in Thai and Cambodian music.

name: clapper (egyptian ancient clappers)
description: Made of wood, bone or metal, this ancient instrument is the forerunner to many other struck idiophones

name: cuíca
description: The cuíca is a Brazilian friction drum often used in samba music.

name: cylindrical drum
description: A cylindrical drum is a straight-sided and generally two-headed drum.

name: daf
description: The daf is a large Persian frame drum used in popular and classical music. The frame is usually made of hardwood with many metal ringlets attached and the membrane is usually goatskin.

name: daire
description: A larger version of tef, used to indicate the rhythmic structures (usul) in makam music.

name: daluo
description: The daluo is a Chinese large flat gong whose pitch drops when struck with a padded mallet.

name: darbuka
description: The darbuka is an hourglass-shaped goblet drum from Greece, the Middle East and India.

name: davul
description: Davul, turkish drum

name: dhol
description: Double headed drum from India.

name: dholak
description: dholak, classical North Indian hand drum

name: dohol
description: The dohol is a large cylindrical drum used in Iran and Afghanistan.

name: drum (Generic drums of any kind.)
description: Any kind of idiophone with membranes, variously sized drums. For the instrument commonly known as "drums" use drumset

name: drums (drum set) (Set of drums in modern music)
description: Set of drums developed from the 1930's onward, it is used in Jazz, Swing, Rock and Pop music. It consists of snare drum, tom-toms, hi-hats, cymbals and bass drum.

name: duggi (indian clay kettle drum)
description: made of clay with two layers of goat skin, it is used as a rhythmic accompaniment to shehnai players and is one of the instruments of the Baul community.

name: dulcitone (idiophone keyboard instrument with tuning forks)
description: keyboard instrument where keyed hammers hit tuning forks - making this tuned percussion

name: dunun
description: Dunun is a family of West African cylindrical drums.

name: foot percussion
description: Percussion performed with the feet, such as foot tapping and clogging.

name: friction idiophone
description: Friction idiophones are idiophones where the sound is created by the instrument being rubbed.

name: fundeh (Nyabinghi middle pitch drum)
description: middle size/pitch drum, it has a slack goat skin membrane and it is hit with the palms. Important in the Jamaican Burru music and Rastafari movement, it is part of the Nyabinghi/Akete drums.

name: gankogui
description: Gankogui, iron bell

name: ganzá
description: The ganzá is a cylinder-shaped Brazilian rattle used in samba music.

name: garifuna drum
description: The garifuna drum is a membranophone from the Garifuna culture in Belize, Guatemala and Honduras.

name: ghatam
description: Ghatam, a South Indian Carnatic music percussion instrument

name: glass harmonica (Glass bowls mounted on spindle)
description: Taking the concept of musical glasses but mounting the incrementing bowls on a turnable spindle, it is played with damp fingers.

name: glass harp (Musical Glasses)
description: Known in Persia as far back as the 14th century, it consists of glass containers, tuned by either being filled with water or later being of different sizes. Played by rubbing dampened fingers on the rims.

name: goblet drum
description: Goblet drums are single-headed drums with a goblet shaped body.

name: gong bass drum
description: A gong bass drum is a large single drumhead which resembles a gong.

name: gramorimba
description: The gramorimba is a lithophone, similar to a xylophone whose bars are made of stone.

name: güira (Dominican metal scraper)
description: Made of metal with many small notches scraped with a brush or hair pick, it is used in Merengue típico.

name: handbell (Open hand-rung bell)
description: Open in one end, it has a strap to hold while ringing.

name: handpan (Tuned metal ufo)
description: Invented initially as the Hang, it is made of two tuned metal convex pans glued together creating an UFO shape.

name: hi-hat
description: A hi-hat is a typical part of a drum kit, consisting of a pair of cymbals mounted on a stand.

name: hue puruwai (Māori taonga pūoro shaking gourd)
description: Gourd (hue) shakers with seeds intact

name: hyoshigi (Japanese concussion idiophone)
description: Used in traditional kabuki and bunraku theatre, it consists of two hardwood pieces tied together with ornamental cord.

name: idiophone
description: An idiophone is a musical instrument which creates sound by the instrument as a whole vibrating without the use of strings or membranes.

name: janggu
description: The janggu or janggo is a double-headed hourglass shaped drum which is the most widely used drum used in the traditional music of Korea.

name: jing
description: The jing is a large gong used in traditional Korean music.

name: junjung (Sacred royal Serer war drum)
description: Sacred cylindrical goat or cattle rawhide drum, traditionally it was held with straps or placed on a stand and played horizontally while walking to battle, on special state occasions and religious ceremonies.

name: kanjira
description: The kanjira is a South Indian frame drum.

name: kartal
description: The kartal is an Indian percussion instrument with jingles, played with the hands, mainly used in Kirtans, Bhajans and in Rajastani folk music.

name: khong wong
description: The khong wong is a gong circle consisting of a number of gongs in a horizontal circular rattan frame. The player sits in the middle.

name: khong wong lek
description: The khong wong lek is a gong circle used in Thai classical music. It has 18 tuned bossed gongs and is smaller and higher in pitch than the khong wong yai.

name: khong wong yai
description: The khong wong yai is a gong circle used in the music of Thailand. It has 16 tuned bossed gongs and is larger and lower in pitch than the khong wong lek.

name: khulsan khuur (bamboo mongolian jew's harp)
description: used for folksongs, particularly by young girls.

name: kkwaenggwari
description: The kkwaenggwari is a small flat brass gong, typically about 20cm in diameter, which is used primarily in the folk music of Korea.

name: klong khaek
description: The klong khaek is a double-headed barrel drum from Thailand. The heads are different sizes.

name: klong song na
description: The klong song na is a barrel drum from Thailand. It is played with the hands and is used in the piphat ensemble.

name: klong that
description: Klong that are large barrel drums from Thailand. They are played in a pair using wooden sticks and are used in the piphat ensemble.

name: klong yao
description: The klong yao is a goblet drum from Thailand which is usually decorated with a colourful skirt.

name: kös
description: A Turkish drum used in the traditional Ottoman military bands

name: kotsuzumi
description: The kotsuzumi or simply tsuzumi is an hourglass-shaped Japanese drum with cords that can be squeezed or released to increase or decrease the tension of the heads.

name: krakebs
description: Krakebs are large metal castanet-like instruments which are the primary rhythmic component of Gnawa music.

name: kudüm
description: Turkish pair of small, hemispherical drums

name: lamellophone
description: Lamellophones are a family of musical instruments which have one or more long thin plates - "lamella" or "tongues" - which are fixed at one end and free at the other end. The free end is plucked, causing the plate to vibrate.

name: lithophone
description: A lithophone is a musical instrument consisting of a rock or pieces of rock which are struck to produce musical notes.

name: madal
description: Madal, hand drum originating from Nepal

name: maddale
description: Maddale is a double-headed drum from Karnataka, India. It is the primary rhythmic accompaniment in Yakshagana.

name: marímbula
description: The marímbula is a plucked box musical instrument from the Caribbean.

name: mark tree
description: A mark tree consists of many small chimes arranged in order of length which hang from a bar. The chimes are played by sweeping a finger or stick through the length of the hanging chimes.

name: mbira
description: The mbira or kalimba (also known by many other names) is an African thumb piano.

name: membranophone (generic drums of any kind)
description: Any kind of idiophone with membranes, variously sized drums.

name: morsing (Indian mouth harp)
description: Indian mouth harp, played in Carnatic and Rajastani folk music.

name: mridangam
description: The mridangam is a double-sided drum from India.

name: mukkuri (Ainu jew's harp)
description: The mukkuri is an Ainu jew's harp.

name: nagadou-daiko
description: The nagadou-daiko is an elongated barrel-shaped Japanese drum.

name: não bạt / chập chõa
description: Various types of cymbal. Also called chũm chọe

name: naobo
description: Chinese cymbals specially used in the Beijing opera.

name: octoban (racked 4 or 8 tom-toms)
description: Small but long tom-toms set in groups of four or eight, they are a common addition in drumsets. Originally made of fibreglass, today also acrylic, aluminium or wood is used, and homemade ones of f.ex PVC are not uncommon.

name: ōtsuzumi
description: The ōtsuzumi is an hourglass-shaped Japanese drum, larger than the kotsuzumi.

name: pahū (Māori taonga pūoro large signalling drum)
description: Logs or thick planks up to 9 meters long used as signalling drums, as gongs for both war and peace. Even living hollowed trees have been used as pahū.

name: pahū pounamu (Māori taonga pūoro gong made of jade and bone)
description: Gong made of pounamu; greenstone and pilot-whale bone with a striker made of akeake, a hardwood.

name: pakhavaj
description: The pakhavaj is an Indian barrel-shaped, two-headed drum used in Hindustani music.

name: pākuru (Māori taonga pūoro tapping sticks)
