description: Two rods, one is held in the mouth, which works as a resonance chamber while chanting and singing, the other is used for tapping and scraping, creating rhythm.

name: pātē
description: The pātē is a Polynesian slit drum made from a hollowed-out log.

name: phách
description: Phách are small wooden sticks beaten on a small piece of bamboo or a wooden block. The sound produced is used to keep time.

name: pkhachich
description: The pkhachich is a traditional shaken percussion instrument of the Circassian peoples.

name: plucked idiophone
description: Plucked idiophones have spikes, nails or flexible tongues ("lamellae") that are plucked in various ways to produce sound.

name: poi (Māori taonga pūoro flax leaf balls used in dancing)
description: Flax leaf balls filled with seeds, swung around to create rhythmic and visual patterns. An important element in the dance also known as poi.

name: primero
description: The primero is a tenor garifuna drum.

name: qilaut
description: The qilaut is an Inuit frame drum which has a handle and is made of caribou skin.

name: quijada
description: The quijada is a traditional Latin percussion instrument made from the jawbone a mule, horse, or donkey that is cleaned of tissue and dried so the teeth can loosen and act as a rattle.

name: rammana
description: The rammana is a frame drum used in classical Thai and Cambodian music which forms one part of thon and rammana.

name: ranat ek
description: The ranat ek is a Thai xylophone which consists of 21 wooden bars suspended by cords over a boat-shaped trough resonator and struck by two mallets.

name: ranat kaeo
description: The ranat kaeo is a Thai instrument similar to a xylophone consisting of glass bars of varying lengths.

name: ranat thum
description: The ranat thum is a xylophone from Thailand consisting of 18 wooden bars suspended by cords over a boat-shaped trough resonator. It is similar to the ranat ek but lower in pitch.

name: reco-reco
description: The reco-reco is a scraped

name: repeater (Nyabinghi smaller pitch drum)
description: also known as kette or keteh, it is the smallest size/pitch drum. It has a tight goat skin membrane and it is struck with the fingertips. Important in the Jamaican Burru music and Rastafari movement, it is part of the Nyabinghi/Akete drums.

name: repinique
description: The repinique is a cylindrical drum from Brazil.

name: riq
description: The riq is a type of tambourine used as a traditional instrument in Arabic music.

name: rōria (Māori taonga pūoro jew's harp)
description: thin quiet jew's harp-like instrument made of wood or bone.

name: rototom
description: The rototom is a drum which has no shell and is tuned by rotating.

name: sabar
description: The sabar is a drum from Senegal which is normally played with one hand and one stick. The body is an elongated cylinder with tapered ends. The head is made of goatskin and is attached to the body using pegs.

name: saron
description: The saron is an Indonesian musical instrument which is used in the gamelan. It normally has seven bronze bars placed on top of a resonating frame.

name: segunda
description: The segunda is a bass garifuna drum.

name: sênh tiền
description: The sênh tiền is a Vietnamese instrument which is a combination of clappers, a rasp and a jingle, made from three pieces of wood with old Chinese coins attached.

name: shekere
description: The shekere is a shaker from West Africa consisting of a gourd with beads woven into a net which covers the gourd.

name: shime-daiko
description: The shime-daiko is a small Japanese drum with a short but wide body which has a higher pitch than a normal taiko.

name: sistrum
description: The sistrum is a metal rattle associated with ancient Iraq and Egypt.

name: slit drum
description: A slit drum is a hollow percussion instrument made of wood or bamboo with a slit at the top.

name: song loan
description: The song loan is a traditional Vietnamese instrument consisting of a hollow wooden body (about 7 cm in diameter) attached to a flexible spring with a wooden ball on the other end and played with the foot.

name: struck idiophone
description: Struck idiophone are ones where sound comes from striking the instrument and it as a whole vibrates, without the use of strings or membranes. Therefore these are most often made of sonorous material: metal, wood, glass and even stone.

name: surdo
description: The surdo is a large bass drum used in Brazilian music, most notably samba.

name: t'rưng
description: The t'rưng is a bamboo xylophone from the central highlands of Vietnam which is played by ethnic groups such as the Bahnar and the Ê Đê.

name: tabla
description: The tabla is a pair of hand drums used in Hindustani classical music and in the traditional music of India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Nepal, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

name: tabor (one-handed sidedrum)
description: Side drum, often with one or more snares, worn by one person and beaten by one hand, it is often combined with tabor pipes.

name: taiko
description: Japanese traditional drum beaten with sticks called bachi.

name: tamborim
description: The tamborim is a small frame drum from Brazil.

name: tanbou ka
description: Tanbou ka or Tambu ka (a small high-pitched drum)

name: tap dancing
description: Tap dancing is a type of dance in which the dancer wears special shoes that make a clicking sound as the dancer's feet strike the floor.

name: taphon
description: The taphon is a traditional barrel drum from Thailand.

name: tar (drum)
description: A tar is a single-headed frame drum from North Africa and the Middle East.

name: tef
description: A Turkish version of tambourine / daf, made from animal skin and played with the fingers.

name: temür khuur (steel mongolian jew's harp)
description: used in folkmedisine and shamanistic rituals

name: thavil
description: The thavil is a barrel shaped drum from South India.

name: The Great Stalacpipe Organ (electrically actuated lithophone)
description: Located in the Luray Caverns of Virginia USA, it is made of an electric console wired to mallets striking thirty-seven stalactites producing tones. This is a singular specific instrument, not an instrument type

name: thon
description: The thon is a goblet drum with a ceramic or wooden body used in classical Thai and Cambodian music which forms one part of thon and rammana.

name: ti bwa
description: ti bwa, percussion instrument made of a piece of bamboo laid horizontally and beaten with sticks

name: timpani
description: Timpani (Kettle drum)

name: tinya
description: The tinya is a small drum used in the traditional music of the Andes.

name: tōkere (Māori taonga pūoro castanets)
description: Castanets of wood, bone, bivalve shells or even flax leaf.

name: tom-tom
description: A tom-tom (or just tom) is a cylindrical drum with no snare, commonly found in a standard drum set.

name: trống bông
description: The trống bông is a wooden Vietnamese drum with a single drumhead which is played with both hands.

name: tubulum (PVC pipe instrument)
description: Invented (or atleast made popular by) Blue Man Group, it is made of alternating length PVC pipes and hit with sticks or flaps. It is popular with street musicians.

name: tumutumu (Māori taonga pūoro ancient struck percussion)
description: Made of resonating stone, wood or bone with a striker of stone, bone or hardwood, this ancient instrument was used for rhythm during chanting.

name: txalaparta (Traditional Basque idiophone)
description: Traditionally consisting of two long wooden planks with corn-husks attached for vibration and hit with long, thick sticks called Makilak, today the planks are shorter and can be made of many other materials like stone, wood or metal and are hit with shorter, lighter sticks.

name: typewriter
description: A typewriter, used for percussion (either keys or bells)

name: udu
description: The udu is a Nigerian idiophone consisting of a water jug with an additional hole.

name: whip / slapstick (Hinged percussion)
description: Consisting of two parts joined together by a hinge, it creates a whip-like sound when clacked together.

name: wind chime
description: Wind chimes are chimes constructed from suspended tubes, rods, bells or other objects, designed to be hung outside and played by the wind.

name: wooden fish
description: A wooden fish is an idiophone often used during Buddhist rituals in East Asia.

name: Wurlitzer electric piano
description: The Wurlitzer electric piano is an electric piano where flat steel reeds are struck by felt hammers.

name: xiaoluo
description: The xiaoluo is a Chinese small flat gong whose pitch rises when struck with the side of a flat wooden stick.

name: xylorimba
description: The xylorimba is an extended-range xylophone.

name: yonggo
description: The yonggo is a barrel drum with a dragon painted on its shell which is used in daechwita, a genre of traditional Korean music.

name: yu (wooden tiger scraped with bamboo whisk)
description: From atleast 600 BC, it is made of wood to resemble a tiger with its spine made into notches. Notches are scraped to produce sound, it was used in ensemble with zhu.

name: zabumba
description: The zabumba is a bass drum from Brazil.

name: żafżafa
description: The żafżafa or rabbaba is a Maltese friction drum consisting of a container (made of tin, pottery or wood) covered with animal skin with a long Arundo donax reed attached.

name: zarb
description: The zarb is a goblet drum from Persia.

name: zill
description: Zills are tiny metallic finger cymbals used in belly dancing and other similar performances.

name: analog synthesizer (uses analogue circuits to produce sound)
description: using analogue circuits and techniques to produce sound electronically, the first types where created in the 1920's with thermionic valves and other electromechanical machineries.

name: bass synthesizer
description: A bass synthesizer is used to create sounds in the bass range.

name: clavioline (electronic keyboard, forerunner to analogue syntheziers)
description: an early analogue synthezier, it had a vacuum tube oscillator and high/low pass filtering to produce vibrato

name: disk drive
description: as using drives for producing music, harddrives, floppy, cd or other.

name: elektronium (electronic keyboard accordion)
description: in the form of a piano accordion, the keys control the output, pitch and sound, bellows control only volume. Sold by Hohner since 1952, it has gone through many modernisations through the years.

name: EWI
description: EWI (an acronym for electric wind instrument) is the name of Akai's wind controller.

name: floppy disk drive
description: Floppy Drives configured to produce tones while reading, software is used.

name: guitar synthesizer
description: A guitar synthesizer is any one of a number of systems that allow a guitar player to play synthesizer sound.

name: Guitaret (electric lamellophone)
description: small white electric thumb piano with metal tines and an electromagnetic pickup.

name: guitorgan (el guitar / el organ hybrid)
description: Invented in 1966 by vox, and in 1969 by Bob Murrell, it is an electric guitar with electronic organ wiring and knobs added.

name: hard disk drive
description: Harddisk configured to produce tones in pattern.

name: keytar
description: An electric keyboard slung over the shoulder by a strap like a guitar, it has soundcontrols placed on the neck

name: laser harp
description: A laser harp is an electronic musical instrument consisting of several laser beams to be blocked, in analogy with the plucking of the strings of a harp, in order to produce sounds.

name: Lyricon
description: The Lyricon is an electronic wind instrument.

name: marimba lumina
description: A marimba lumina is a MIDI controller that lets a musician play music via a control surface based on the layout of a marimba.

name: ondioline (early analogue synth with various sounds and "vibrato" keyboard)
description: one of the first analogue synths, it had a filter bank with 15 sliders for different sounds, and a "vibrato" inducing keyboard based on the ondes Martenot's.

name: Otamatone (Toy synthesizer)
description: Shaped like an eighth-note with a cute face, it is played with one hand fingering the neck and the other squeezing the head to create wah-wah.

name: Pianet (an electromechanical piano)
description: An electromechanical piano (not to be confused with electronic piano) designed and produced by Hohner in the 1960 and 70s.

name: Reactable
description: The Reactable is an electronic musical instrument consisting of a round translucent table on which blocks are placed.

name: telharmonium (gigantic electronic organ transmitted through telephone wires.)
description: considered the first electromechanical musical instrument, an early electronic organ.

name: trautonium (monophonic electric instrument from 1930's)
description: Electric instrument from the 1930's with a resistor wire and moving metal plate.

name: tubon (analogue electronic monophonic Organ)
description: electronic bass organ proto-keytar

name: video game console (sound chip from gaming consoles)
description: Sound chip in various video game consoles used for music, chiefly in bit-tunes and chip-tunes

name: wind synthesizer (synthesizer played like a wind instrument)
description: wind synthesizer or wind controller, it is connected to a midi controller and is played like a wind instrument.

name: bass
description: Bass is a common but generic credit which refers to more than one instrument, the most common being the bass guitar and the double bass (a.k.a. contrabass, acoustic upright bass, wood bass). Please use the correct instrument if you know which one is intended.

name: bullroarer
description: A bullroarer consists of a piece of wood attached to a long cord which is then swung in a circle.

name: effects
description: Effects refers to devices which enable a musician to modify the sound of an instrument.

name: electric piano
description: An electric piano is an electro-mechanical musical instrument. Depending on the type of electric piano, the tones may be produced by strings, reeds or tuning forks.

name: gizmo (Elguitar/bass effect device)
description: An effects device to be clamped on the bridge, it produces "synthesizer-like" sounds

name: hydraulophone ("woodwater" flute made with hydraulics)
description: Made of tubing with holes that may have everything from none to two reeds, water instead of air comes out of the holes. Sound is produced by covering the holes with fingers, altering the flow of water through the holes.

name: lasso d'amore
description: The lasso d'amore, whirly tube or corrugaphone is a corrugated plastic tube which is spun in a circle.

name: musical saw
description: A musical saw is a hand saw used as a musical instrument. It is usually played by bowing the non-serrated edge.

name: other instruments
description: Other instruments. If you can't find an instrument, please request it.

name: pūrerehua (Māori taonga pūoro bullroarer)
description: made of wood, bone or stone it has a long string attached, when spun around it produces a deep, loud whizzing sound that can be heard from far away.

name: suikinkutsu
description: A suikinkutsu is a type of Japanese garden ornament which uses dripping water to create music. Although it is also known as a Japanese water zither, it is named after the sound the koto (a Japanese zither) makes and is not actually a string instrument.

name: talkbox
description: A talkbox is an effects device which enables a musician to modify the sound of an instrument.

name: turntable
description: Used in turntablism, vinyl records are not simply played on it, instead DJ's perform creating sound.

name: żummara
description: The żummara is a Maltese instrument similar to a kazoo. It is made out of a piece of bamboo reed covered on one end by greaseproof paper tied with string. A melody is then hummed into a hole in the reed producing a rough raspy sound. Not to be confused with the Egyptian/Iraqi zummara which is an instrument similar to a chalemeau.
